Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway from Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Furqan M
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a vacation with a buddy; we spent two nights at this hotel and absolutely loved it! I would highly recommend staying here for a few nights when you get tired of the cramped and touristy Sultanahmet area! The Sheraton is approximately a forty minute train ride to Sultanahmet and will cost you either 4 or 6 Lira. So you could technically stay here and commute to Sultanahmet if you wanted. The rooms are INCREDIBLE--tastefully decorated and spacious. Our bathroom in this Sheraton was almost the same size as our ENTIRE room in Sultanahmet! The workout room was incredible. Unfortunately, they were renovating the pool so we couldn't see that but I heard it was amazing. There are also some restaurants hidden behind the hotel--including a fried chicken joint and a Pizza Hut. Although most people seem to say this hotel is only good for business purposes, I would disagree. We finished all of our tourist activities in SUltanahmet in three days. After that, it isn't worth paying more for those tiny rooms when you can pay about $50 less per night AND get better rooms here! Finally, I did want to give a shout-out to the bellhop (I'm blanking on his name). He was awesome! He was very helpful with directions and went out of his way to help us find a Burger King and get us delivery to the hotel. I will definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but for business purposes only, preferably in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadine_Moscow
Reviews.Content: Pros: - the price is affordable, especially if you compare it with Moscow hotels:)) and have a special discount. - the room service is really, really good, all the stuff is very friendly and helpful - the breakfast is well-served and tasty, though it's a problem to have your teacup filled - waiters are too busy. - rooms are nice and comfortable, though not the style I like, but they seem a little bit shabby, especially in the bathroom, and some minor things are not working - jalousie, for example. The bed is very comfortable. - the congress center is modern and covenient. - spa center is a very nice add-on to your working day. We had a real pleasure in th hammam (I do hope I've spelled it right) cons: - very far away from city center and not easy to get there, even on a taxi, cause there is a bit of traffic jams in Istanbul. Also nowhere to go in the vicinity - no chance for a pleasant evening walk. - a significant minus for a business hotel - wifi internet connection in the rooms is additional 18 euros a day. It's at least strange in my opinion. To be fair - they have free wifi access in the lobby including available PCs, but I think that a 5-star business hotel should provide free access everywhere. Generally - it does not suit you if you want to see old Istanbul and it's perfect if you have business in this very hotel, a congress held there for example.

Reviews.Title: “if you like to feel home,this is the right hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad K
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip to Ä°stanbul.The hotel is extremely clean,very comfortable rooms and large beds,delicios foods...Service was great from the all smiling faces staff. The hotel is located in the center of business district of Ä°stanbul.It is close by to the metro station also 15 minutes access time to Taksim Square. I would recommend to anyone who may prefer to stay in this excellent hotel. Hoping to stay for the near future...

Reviews.Title: “Luxirious”
Reviews.Author: JaggerGirl
Reviews.Content: I loved it. Service was great and hotel is super beautiful. View from 23rd floor was amazing. Unfortunatelly there is a construction next to it, and right now it can kinda bother. However, you can get to best shopping malls for like 10-12 Liras by cab. Oh, and there is free WiFI in the lobby. yey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: nagatasuma
Reviews.Content: This is a very nÄ±ce hotel, in a great location when business traveling to Istanbul. ul Very close to the ITU Metro Station and concierge made my day beautiful. We would recommend to anyone staying in London for business in great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Farahsamir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely clean, very comfortable rooms and beds, delicious food. Its not in downtown, but its a 30 turkish lira ride to downtown (Taksim) with a taxi, or you can take the metro which is a minute away. I went there for a convention with my family. The service was excellent, the staff were professional and the convention rooms were very good. "Istinye Park" mall is a 6 minute walk if you want to do some serious shopping. They have everything from high end stores to basic stores. All in all, I recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Kind, thoughtful staff”
Reviews.Author: merryole
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful, went out of their way to help; they were genuinely interested in us. The food was excellent at all meals: fresh breads, fresh fruits, quickly-replenished hot items; pleasantly-understated presentation. Marble floors and decorations gave us the feel of being in a local hotel rather than in a chain. Unfortunately the room was rather warm for us: 26Ëš C and the engineer could not get the air conditioner to work. Shrugging and smiling, he propped a window open for us, hoping that would help temporarily. The hotel is located in a business district without much else nearby, so it is fortunate the food was so good. It is a short walk to ITÃœ Metro station, so access is good to Levent, Taksim, ÅžhiÅŸhane and the city center. The Metro, by the way, is wonderfulâ€”clean, frequent, and easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: arul_nambi2000
Reviews.Content: Not sure about the locality.But was quite an easy location to reach other tourist spots in Istanbul. Food was with variety,i was comfortable with my bakery items and fruits and biscuits. Check it time took us lil longer since we were in a group. Net facility was also quite user friendly. Other wise good to stay for long time

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stays”
Reviews.Author: MexKaz
Reviews.Content: Excelent fitness center. Rooms have very old furniture. They need some upgrades, even the best rooms. Service is very good, value is regular, location... Well everything is relative, business wise is good, specially for the surrounding business center, for tourism this is not the right place.

Reviews.Title: “congratulations”
Reviews.Author: msnmz
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maslak is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed! Rooms are comfortable, staff is so helpful and friendly. There are lots of choices in the buffets for brekfast and all are so delicious. I could go to Taksim Square easily by metro. I would like to stay again. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Pinar A
Reviews.Content: i have never stay in my life such a large and comfortable room .. beds are excellent...restrourant is delicious :) thank you sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern business hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricPDC
Reviews.Content: This is a modern business hotel based in the business district of Maslak. I wouldn't recommend this hotel as a base for exploring the old town as it is a good 30 mins away by either taxi or metro. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff are efficient and friendly. The pool and health club are very good. Wifi is free in the lobby business centre but is charged for in your room (which is always annoying). Yes, the heating/air conditioning is not so great but I didn't find it to be too much of an issue. As a business hotel it is definitely fit for purpose and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “overheated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sbfrech
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big, bathroom as well, beds are comfortable but I still couldn't sleep! I have been staying 3 times at this hotel in the last 4 weeks and I have the same problem everytime (and as other people here already reported): the rooms cannot cool down! It is so hot, that I am sweating and cannot sleep. Opening the window is not in option as the window doesn't stay open unless something is jammed between the window. Also, it creates a draft that blows not only through the whole room, but also underneath the door to the hallway while making big noise. After repeated complaints, I was told that it is winter and air conditioning is not working in winter. Really: I don't want air conditioning ON, I only want the heat OFF!!!! And not even that is possible! Good points about the hotel: the gym is amazing, as it is a real gym where people usually have normal memberships.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning nightmare....”
Reviews.Author: Bengjork
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the Sheraton Maslak and is unfortunately stuck here for a few days due to a conference that we are running. Arrived with loads of conference materials but no help at the entrance, had to carry all my bags in a short flight of stairs, which was when the help came. Check in was quick and being an SPG platinum was given a room on the 18th floor with a view of a construction building. A quick look around and u will notice, the toilet walls have molds in them, the walls are chipped here and there and the floor has several scratch marks. All of those are still bearable but the worst is the airconditioning which is set to heater mode! It maybe 2 degrees outside but in my room it's a seering 30 degrees! I complained to front desk several times to get someone to fix the aircon but the standard answer was the hotel is set to hot mode! (whatevah that means!) I really could not bear the heat so called them again and was offered another room on the same floor with the same non-working AC! One of the guys who checked my room even suggested that i keep the window open....yeah to all the street noise! I cannot believe we are paying so much only to get a fan in the room and not even a functioning AC! I have read so many replies by the management to complains regarding improving the central (non)cooling system but I guess this hotel just doesn't care. I'm praying that a miracle will happen in my 4 nights of stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel w/minor issues”
Reviews.Author: The_Protagonist
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel and I must admit I have mixed feelings. Looks good on the outside, spacious rooms - but they need refresh, sometimes, especially the bathroom; it was not too good. About the location - well, this is not touristic center for sure, but there is good taxi connection and car as well. Very good spa, decent restaurant, rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Flight cancelled and would not refund my hotel reservation charge”
Reviews.Author: tina j
Reviews.Content: My flight was cancelled and so I had to take a redeye to the Istanbul then connect to a flight to Bodrum. They would not accomodate my unfortunate predicament by offering to refund my one night room charge. Harsh policy for a Starwood Preferred Guest and considering that the flight cancellation was not my fault. You would think a hospitality company such as Starwood would have a more accomodating policy to "help" their regular customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and facilities, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: FashionFish
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a "Superior room" for 2 nights in November 2011. The hotel lobby, breakfast area (Cafe 333) and the health club were all in very good condition, newly renewed it seemed. But the room must have been at least 15-20 years old, the interior design felt like 80s-90s design. For the price I would have expected a bit more. Apart from the sligthly old feeling the room was ok, it was clean, the bed was comfortable, tv worked fine. The breakfast was great, a lot of fresh fruits, many types of bread, good muesli section, sausages, scrambled eggs, pancake, lots of different type of juice. I also had the time to try out the health club. The pool was nice, sauna and steam room were great, they also had a Turkish Bath/Hamam. One of the evenings I took a massage, a "Relax massage" which was great, the girls were very nice. Overall a good stay, I would stay again if I had business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but temperatur far too high (AC was shut off)”
Reviews.Author: ARP_11
Reviews.Content: Good location, 5 min walking distance to office and Metro. Excellent restaurant (good food, price and service) close to hotel - turn right exiting hotel, walk 5-7 min passed Metro and restaurant on your right (forgot the name).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alex_cps
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. I got a recently renovated room on the 8th floor. It was really well decorated, modern, beds are very comfortable and there's a large screen tv. Location is excellent, close to the subway (Impossible to go around Istambul by car... traffic jams are literally everywhere). Breakfast is complete, business area offers free internet access, if you want it in your room you have to pay extra 18Eur. I would go back to this hotel, but just make sure you get a non smoking room. The old rooms have problems with the heating system (I had colleagues who complained that couldn't shut the heating off and they forced into a "sauna" for 3 nights in a row with no apparent solution from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: RSHAH26
Reviews.Content: Ok this hotel is pretty good. Service was 9/10 and the rooms are fantastic (large, flat screens, bathroom space. However when I stayed here in August 2011, there were renovations going on in the fitness and spa center. The center is also large and after renovation, I imagine that it will be quite good. When I was there, they had a basketball court, racquetball, and a full gym. The spa had a swimming pool and a whirlpool that overlooks the area. Once again about the service: amazing The guest service manager helped us with everything we asked for and more. My family has unusual requests. We wanted to go to the black sea, on the day of our flight back home, and which isnt the most popular place, and he came back with a great plan and satisified our time requirements. The reason why i am closer to giving this 3.5 out of 5 is because of its location. It is quite far from the main areas of sultanahamet, grand bazaar and spice bazaar. You need to take public transportation to get to the area and some cabs wont take you back to the hotel once you are in the main city. All in all its around a 30 minute one way commute to the city. If for some reason, you are visiting the istanbul suburbs or closer to the black sea, I would recommend this place. But if you really want to experience Istanbul, I would stay somewhere not as nice but much closer.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, great gym, easy access from Metro”
Reviews.Author: ckanchan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during late 2010. Not getting early check in was disappointed, after long over night flights. The room in the hotel was very spacious and comfortable. Gym hall had all facilities one would expect. Great selection of food in the buffet breakfast. Overall, I satisfied with my stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ericandrewpandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the business district and is a long way from the main sights and attractions of istanbul. Its location is niether scenic nor panoramic as it stands on the roadside of a six line highway, with a flyover as well. In other words you need a good reason to stay in this hotel. The hotel experience was rather nondescript. The double room was only prepared for one person, i.e. one robe, pair of slippers etc. The check in was niether welcoming nor rude, just fairly perfunctory. I asked for an iron and ironing board which I was told would be in the room, but there was none. Internet access in the room is 18 euros per day, no option to charge by the hour. The room itself was spacious and clean, with some lights not working and no hotel guide to services in the room (and also the hotel has no map of Istanbul that includes the hotel location. The hotel offers turkish bath and other spa treatments, with no English explanation it was difficult to know what was on offer. Respect for privacy and dignity was not a feature of the massage my wife experienced! Breakfast is okay but the staff are too zealous in clearing things away. All in all I would only suggest that you stay here if you have a meeting in the hotel or nearby. .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a business area”
Reviews.Author: Tiny B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a convenient business location, also a short ride by taxi from the Bosforus area. Food in the hotel "333" restaurant is good value for the price. Especially friendly is the staff at the Reception desk (always ready to help and to assist).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a business area of Istanbul, far away from sights”
Reviews.Author: ViennaMichael
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maslak is located in the Maslak area, a commercial area with lots of company headquarters. Beside all the business travellers there is a large group of Chines and Japanese bus toursits. Lobby and Rooms have been renovated recently and look really nice. Restaurant as well. The area aroun the hotel does not look very appealing, lots of construction sites. There is an underground line directly opposite of the hotel, but I would not recommend the hotel if you come to Istanbul for sightseeing or vacation. The leasure center was under renovation during my last stay, the pool did not look very appelaing and water was dirty. Some saunas are available and showers. The fitness center seemed to be OK, but some areas were closed due to the renovation. All in all, if you are there on a business trip in the Maslak area, its OK to stay there, if you come as a toursit, try to stay closer to the Big Basar and downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Maslak - Not the usual Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: TravellorNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: I would rate this as average. Room service took long to come and deliver. Food at the Coffee shop was good but can be better. We had to carry our luggage by ourself no one even offered any help. Was quite disappointed......

Reviews.Title: “Not so Sheraton style....!”
Reviews.Author: ssjordan23
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for 4 nights, unfortunately nothing looks like the fancy lobby and the entrance in the rooms. Stayed in the renovated part but was a real disappointment. What are you looking from a Sheraton chain? stylish, comfortable and luxurious stay? yes the room rates show that but the experience is way below any expectation. Stuff? no consistency. Front desk extremely elegant and care giving, but the restaurant waiters, the vale outside the hotel, just nightmare. The only good thing was the amazing view of Istanbul - if you are lucky enough to get a room above the 8th floor

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Petra M
Reviews.Content: I cheked the hotel on Tripadvisor before and there is a lot of different opinions, but I gave it a try. I have to say I liked it. It is a bit out of center, but with metro station very close. I found a good rate, service was nice, there is a great shopping center close by. Service was good, huge breakfast, welcome fruit upon arrival. One day housekeeping made us nice suprise on beds with sheets. I loved it. the I will be back when I next come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights and loved it. Excellent service and hospitality. Great food in Cafe 333 in the hotel. Hotel staff friendly and always willing to help where needed. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Very good facilities throughout the hotel e.g. gym and swimming pool. Public transport on doorstep. Higly recommended. James and Amanda de Villiers South Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerryHanry
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel for 3 days. Accommodation is really about giving a good service. World cuisine is very rich and delicious dining options they offer. Sheraton Maslak team, thank you very much here.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: alkikirk
Reviews.Content: When we entered the lobby of this hotel it was very nice and well appointed. They provided 4-star service from the entrance to the check-in desk. The surprise came when we entered the room. The furnishings and carpet looked original ~ meaning if I wanted to re-create the 1980's. Even the bathroom tiles were original. There were stains on the carpet and on the furniture. The coach was so old that the springs were busted. We ended up sitting on the chairs and avoiding the furniture. At least the bed had clean sheats. The bathroom shower tiles had mold in the grout and ceiling tiles were missing. We thought that maybe they are in the middle of an upgrade and just haven't got to this floor yet, but I checked the elevator lobbies of a few floors and found that most of them had the same poor quality as our floor. Perhaps they saved the best few floors for prefered guests. We checked out the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a business-stay type of hotel. Not great.”
Reviews.Author: trojanheart05
Reviews.Content: The rooms were standard, old and not that nice. The carpet in the hallways was dirty and the air conditioning didn't work. It was cooler outside than in our room. The area is somewhat business/industrial. Not good for easy sight-seeing or general tourism. There's a starbucks around the corner which was nice and pretty much the only close and convenient place to get snacks. The hotel staff were not the friendliest or more helpful. The breakfast buffet is pricey but very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the metro, noisy due to traffic.”
Reviews.Author: LowBrow_Rambler
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Maslak Sheraton was booked for work- convenient location next to ITU metro stop. The hotel has a luxurious lobby, my room was ridiculously huge, service was great from room service to reception. Wi-fi is extremely expensive, I highly recommend booking a package with Internet included. Istanbul is a city that never sleeps but the road noise was still very loud in the room and the nearest mosque has a tone-deaf Imam.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel, but reasonable”
Reviews.Author: RobbieFulton
Reviews.Content: If you are doing business in Maslak area, this is perfectly situated and it probably meets all your needs. It is a functional big hotel (not Sheraton, but licensed by Sheraton...) and although the finishing touches are not always perfect, the rooms are large and well designed and the service is reasonably good. Breakfast is quantity rather than quality and I hate to say it but Cafe Nero round the corner does a better job. Great if you are working here in Maslak but no other reason to stay here. Service variable but generally fine - the porter couldn't do more to be helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and well run.”
Reviews.Author: TrefBristol
Reviews.Content: I often stay in this hotel for business as it's near our offices. It's really friendly, clean and well run. It is quite a way out of town, so don't expect tourist stuff in walking distance. Also the room rate is good but the food/extras are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: BoredofInternational
Reviews.Content: A youth hostel would have been less shabby and cleaner - I don't want to pay 160EURO a night and be worried about touching the walls of the bathroom as they are covered in mildew and dirty. Drinks were very expensive and location is poor. i suspect 90% of hotels in Istanbul would be better

Reviews.Title: “â€œFine Hotel but nothing extraordinary!â€�”
Reviews.Author: DavronM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sheraton Maslak for 7 days! I was given room on 22nd floor so called Club Room with very modern HI-Tech Design Room. Room size quite big with comfy beds. Very good reach collection of bathroom amenities. Staff was professional and pleasant to deal with thou English was not the best! My only concern was breakfasts as menu remained almost the same for 7 days which makes it quite odd! Conference facilities of hotel meet all modern needs. Hotel 15 minute walk away from one of the biggest malls in Istanbul Istinye Park, thou quite away from Taksim and SultanAhmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: nevo13
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Maslak is a very convenient hotel interms of its location- not to far from airport and city center. The most distinguished feature is that the staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant offers delicious and a good varitey of dishs. The room is spacious , one thing though is i felt more maintenance needed to be done with the room, as some electric sockets were not working at the room. Also, cause the hotel has a relatively old system of central airconditioners, that not each single room can control its temperature solely. Apart from that , i would rate Sheraton Maslak as being a very good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: n4zda
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Sheraton Istanbul Maslak Hotel. The staff made an extra effort to be sure that all my needs were taken care of. The lobby atmosphere was very pleasant, and I enjoyed many excellent meals in the resturant. Thanks again to the staff for making my trip to Istanbul a most excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to rest and prepare a working day”
Reviews.Author: lpogliano
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice. The hotel has lots of services and wonderful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice welcome”
Reviews.Author: vogel2102
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the room. They have put a nice fruit basket in the room upon arrival. On the second day they also made my bed full of "duck" symbols with the sheets and duvet, which really made me fell welcome. Great gesturesfrom the housekeeping, I must say. I'm looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skysurfer592
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute dump. Once you check in you are at the staff's mercy. I have had to change several rooms in one night for various reasons. There is no air conditioning , since its "winter" . The rooms are warm and without leaving the window open, its very uncomfortable. Avoid this place at all cost. For a business traveler service is of prime importance. You wont get any here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: daphnecik
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and the both location and the staff working there were excellent. I highly recommend this Hotel. It is also very close to the Istinye Park shopping mall which is the nicest shopping maill in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucky2202
Reviews.Content: Great staff that's for sure. I have stayed here for three nights during stay in Istanbul last month. I have been upgraded to a huge deluxe room, it must have been over 50 m2, since the hotel has been fully booked. Good luck for me. As being on the business trip, not a lot time is left for a sightseeing, but girls from Guest relations made me very nice short program. Hotel is a bit out of town, but with nice underground connections. Just perfect for a business trip with a bit of wandering around. I liked Restaurant also, having a special offer of a Black Sea cuisine. My first try, but I loved the it.

Reviews.Title: “the location is excellent if your visit is related to biz.”
Reviews.Author: Gosalyn4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several times. location of hotel is in the middle of the Maslak business center area. It's only walking distance to plazas. especially with Istanbul's traffic, you gain lots of time. I should say it's far away from sultanahmet but very close Taksim with metro. The staff is very helpful, rooms are large and clean. I can recommend this hotel for your business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel vs. Home”
Reviews.Author: Kokoyza
Reviews.Content: Many people may ask: what should be the selection criteria between two hotel rooms? Especially between two 5 star rooms. The size, the price, the breakfastâ€¦?? They are more or less everywhere the same. And if itâ€™s not about one night or a weekend, you have to live more weeks in a hotel, itâ€™s more important to feel you at home. If the staff at the reception knows you after the first week, if the waiter brings your favorite drink at breakfast without asking, if hotel management allows you to invite friends and cook for them in the hotelâ€™s kitchenâ€¦ Some aspects I found before in other hotels as well, but so all together only here!! But as nothing can be 100% perfect, Iâ€™m not fully satisfied with the pillows /they are too big and hard/, and the safes in the rooms are not with code. You need always to ask for the key at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for Business Use”
Reviews.Author: hillwod
Reviews.Content: I was there when this hotel switched from being the President Hotel to the Sheraton. At the beginning problems were plenty. The last few stays have been enjoyable and exactly what you need as a business traveler. Good breakfast, good beds and good facilities. Efficient and courteous staff make this a very good hotel to stay for any business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home”
Reviews.Author: yasemin_tu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of the Maslak business center area. The rooms are all renovated, very stylish and comfortable. The staff has great attitude and always willing to help. Since there is a metro stop in 2 minutes walk, it is so easy and fast to reach to the city center and to the old city for sightseeing. The best shopping mall in Ä°stanbul is 5 minutes walk away. So, this hotel gives all you need for any kind of travel purpose. Felt like home, didn't even wanna leave .

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: OEskander
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m travelling to Istanbul nearly on monthly bases for the past 3 years and Sheraton Maslak has been always my choice, very nice rooms size and most of which are fully renovated, high speed internet and a nice health club that just been renovated as well, good quality of food and very friendly staff that always do their best, underground station if 5 minutes walk, so itâ€™s a great value for money. Osama Eskander Area Sales Director

Reviews.Title: “Good quality business hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackdragon34
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel for all my business stays in IStanbul . It has very nice re-decorated rooms and facilities. the location is close to the Malak business district. They could improve a little bit on customer service in restaruants and food variety in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: farzam
Reviews.Content: Starting with check in which you usually welcomed with young active stafs, with picking and caring your baggage, depending on what time you arrive in the morning your room will be ready accordingly, and in room what you need is available or they provide immediatley, the laundry service is good and spa center is also advisable to use if you have enough time. i usually use the barber which serves in spa center. That is all which I anticipate with my short time stay in hotel in every trip which at least occours twice during a month, each one, two or at most three nights.

Reviews.Title: “My best choice to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tuncn
Reviews.Content: I prefer Sheraton Istanbul Maslak Hotel since I am sure about their hospitality and quality of service. The team is always so prompt for their guests' needs and expectations. The rooms are very wide and have been recently redecorated. As a business traveller, I can easily find anything I need during my stays at Sheraton Istanbul Maslak Hotel. The location of the hotel is very close to one of the major business centers of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I will surely come back”
Reviews.Author: Aco091268
Reviews.Content: I will surely come back on my next business trip. Clean rooms, great staff, good food. I really enjoyed it. Hotel is situated short walk from the underground station, where you can easy reach Taksim area. It is close to Bosphorus, Istinye, Tarabya parts with a good fish restaurants. I liked evening walk along the

Reviews.Title: “5-stars that did not match the expectation”
Reviews.Author: XO_621
Reviews.Content: As with all big chain hotels also the AHERATON Istanbul Maslak fulfills the expectations you may have. Even inside you may have a hard time to identify exactly in which city you are. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious. The beds offer a comfortable sleep. Any service in the rooms is on charge (including internet access) at high end prices. A inter cafe is offered in the lobby. The restaurant CLUB 333 offers also breakfast service at a high price of 25â‚¬. This is not worth it, even as the quality and choice of food is good and fresh. Located on the outer skirts of town one of the biggest and most luxorious shopping malls is iwithin walking distance of approx. 10, minutes. Also a Metro startion close to the entrance of the hotel gives acces to Istanbul down town within 15-20 minutes. Overall a okay business hotel with a to hig price compared to location and surrounding.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by Sheraton name”
Reviews.Author: Skinnersam
Reviews.Content: this a Sheraton in name only. Old hotels if maintained properly can be charming and welcoming...this hotel is neither. It is simply old, in disrepair with few efforts to hide it's many blemishes. My room temperature was set at 25.5 degrees...fine if it could be regulated...but that was not possible. My Firat call to the front desk was ignored. The second request was made in person...hotels solution was to put a stand up fan in my room that clanged all night. the only redeeming quality of the hotel is it's location to the subway...of course you have to make a dash across three lanes of traffic to get to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Niks12
Reviews.Content: The staff were attentive and friendly. We had been diverted to another airport for 10 hours due to fog so we were very tired when we got to the hotel. They had everything ready for us when we arrived as we were supposed to arrive early in the morning. English is not the first language of the country but the staff could speak it well, and they helped us with directions and transport as this was not easy to figure out. We were in a business district, but the train stop was a 4 minute walk from the hotel. The room was clean and serviced well everyday. They had us up on the 22nd floor and the views were amazing. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrueReview4UME
Reviews.Content: Virtually all the photos you can find of this hotel show RENNOVATED ROOMS spacy with stylish furniture and wooden floors. That's what I was expecting when I got there, having booked for what I thought was a fairly reasonable price, but instead got put into a really ugly, dark old room with worn furniture and fittings. Some staff were annoying and one even rude when I complained. Eventually public relations manageress did try to put it right, but by then I'd lost all interest. Lobby is a bit dark, food is average at best, staff and service "mixed". Previous comment about inefficient elevators is correct, as is comment on location being good for business travellers rather than tourists. I expect that once the rennovation is complete, decent management could make a successful hotel that would be worth staying in, but I would never risk it if I were you unless I was absolutely sure that what I was staying in was a RENNOVATED ROOM (on the top floors!) !!!

Reviews.Title: “It's simple - don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: jaimekm76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst I have stayed in for business - ever. The rooms are in disrepair, the food is inedible and overpriced. The lobby is dark and dank. The staff speak virtually no English (which is unacceptable for a so called 5 star Sheraton Hotel in a major city) and are unhelpful. The electronic key to my room has had to be reprogrammed daily and each time a new staff member has done so without asking for identification to confirm it is my room I am requesting access to - this does not make me feel confident about security. The Executive lounge looks like it was closed down years ago with a few old table and chairs. The hotel is situated accross a highway from a station and is a long way out of the centre of Istanbul. Whilst the metro journey is ok during the day as a female traveller I would not be making a journey at night as the station is eerily quiet. It is an awful hotel - don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel with many weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: ThWilmesi
Reviews.Content: I stayed during my last Business Trip for about two weeks at the Sheraton Maslak Istanbul. I was fortunate to have booked a Club Floor room, which netted me one of their renovated club floor rooms, which overall are quite nice. Nice size with enough space, and good sized bathroom nevertheless without separate shower. One other disadvantage is that on their club floors there are only smoking rooms, which can be very uncomfortable, fortunately i had a room which was not smelling a lot.... TV is ok and club rooms provide free internet access with a good speed.... The club floor lounge currently in their former sky restaurant is a "joke". I have not stayed in such a bad lounge a long time... the breakfast is very bad ( it is better to go down to their normal restaurants) and offerings during the day as well as the cocktail hour is of very low quality. The hotel itself is very dark, and you feel a bit uncomfortable. Another very bad issue are the elevators - two different types of elevator which needs to be called by two different buttons - not synchronized and of incredible low speed, and the hotel only has 3 elevators - it could happen for you in the morning to wait 15 minutes for the elevator .... a joke..... to be honest. Food in their new restaurant CAFE 333 is ok and reasonably priced.... there is another restaurant ( independant) in the hotel - Korean/Chinese which is also ok... but overall noth speical to write about it..... Overall hotel is ok for a short stay but not for a long stay. Will not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this DUMP”
Reviews.Author: raherold
Reviews.Content: Stayed early July 2010. Ugly, inconvenient (unless you have business in Maslak), overpriced. I'm a Starwood Platinum member and stay in lots of SPG hotels. This is one of the worst. Sheraton assumed management of this place after two previous owners ran down the facility over 20 years with very little maintenance. Horrible dark lobby with seedy bar. Well-meaning but poorly trained staff. Many rooms are unrenovated and in terrible shape - see descriptions in other reviews. Spa is old, smells moldy. Tile floors are dangerously slippery when wet - a real hazard. Pool area has needed repair and repainting for many years. "Executive Club" level has inept service/poor facilities. Internet service in my room was terribly slow - could not connect to my work email. Bed was soft and sagged - definitely NOT Sheraton sleeper bed. Yet the hotel advertises and charges as five star! This is a two star level place. Istanbul has so many good hotels in scenic places. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Sheraton Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BhaveshSingh
Reviews.Content: Dont stay at the Sheraton Istanbul Maslak Hotel. Its a classic case of website looks nice but the hotel itself is dreadful. The lifts were not working; there was no club lounge to speak of (even though they claim there is one); the bathrooms had mould on the walls and floors and the bed sheets has some one elses hair on them when we looked closer. I booked two rooms for myself and two children but we left immediately after being shown another set of rooms that were in the same condition. Management refused to refund the money that I had already prepaid (SO BE WARNED HERE) but the rooms were so awful we left any way. We stayed at the Park Hyatt for a little extra cost per night per room and I can say it was one of the best hotels that I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms with lack of service”
Reviews.Author: PiotrParis
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well placed within the business district; rooms are HUGE and nice maintained, swimming pool with hammam and sauna; Restaurants are average with the good breakfast with the fresh orange juice. Only one annoying part is the lack of good service - or I think even non existence of service concept in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, superficially. But nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: YYZErnie
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay at this hotel because it was the meeting hotel for a conference I was attending in Istanbul. This hotel is out in the middle of nowhere, and so guests are somewhat beholden to the hotel restaurants, etc. The food is not impressive, and everything there (drinks at the bar and food) are very expensive. Sometimes the costs are reported in Turkish Lira and other times the prices are reported in Euro. The room cost through the conference was 230 Euro. I managed to find it for 170 Euro on the Sheraton site. I have no idea why this is... It's gouging. The room rate was different for each of the 4 nights I was there because it was converted each day from Euro to Lira, which is a bit odd. The facilities are very nice. My room was huge, contemporary, and had a king bed. Here are the negatives. First, you'd expect that in a large multinational chain such as the Sheraton, every staff member who has guest contact would be at least bilingual in Turkish and English. That is not the case. One day, housekeeping did not clean my bathroom, but took all my towels. The first time I called the operator, she told me she'd take care of bringing me towels. Nothing happened after an hour. When I called back, the operator (I'm not sure if this was the same individual) admitted that she could not speak English. When I tried to exchange some Euro one afternoon, the staff member at the desk admitted he didn't know what I was asking because he didn't speak English. As well, the doormen do not speak English. This was a problem because if you wanted to go out of the hotel somewhere for dinner, there was a good chance that the doormen had no idea about anything... Although I am multilingual, Turkish isn't one of the languages I know... So this was a huge problem. As well, the towels were horrific. They were thin, and frayed. And the face towel that I had on the first day, was never replaced for the duration of my stay because no one knew what a "face towel" was. Fortunately, someone did understand what a "bath mat" was. No one in their right mind would stay at this hotel. It is near nothing. Likely you'd only stay if you had to be at a meeting here.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AbhijeetRanadive
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Sheraton was an experience I have been yaerning to have for quite some time now. The rooms are big, cosy, comfortable, the amenities in the rooms are adequate to meet all requirements of business or leisure travellers. The beds are not too comfortable and tend to give a backache in the mornings. The high speed internet service is not free and is actually expensive at 15 EUROS per day. Star Hotels are expected to provide this service free of cost to their visitors. The drinks bar is well stocked and has a good variety, the continental breakfast served is good with a huge variety of fruits, cheese, cakes and breads available to be gobbled away. The restaurant is not easy to find and you have to to be guided to this area. There is no area to have a change of clothes and pack your bags after you have checked out.... I had to use the spa comon changing room for this. I felt I was no longer important to the hotel staff since I had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Sheraton property, but service levels poor”
Reviews.Author: Reviewss
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms and food variety. Room service, laundry and other services were not upto mark. But location of the hotel makes it a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMTLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute from another Sheraton and couldn't get the one nearer to town. The hotel in in a business district and there is nothing to do nearby and only limited amenities - no shops or restaurants. We wer stranded in Istanbul due to the volcanic ash. It is expensive to use taxis to get around as it is so far out, and the traffic was so bad. There is a metro opposite but it involves getting across a busy slip road and then a footbridge. The hotel itself looked as though it had been built in the 1960s and hadn't been upgraded since. The foyer was very dark and gloomy. Reception staff were not particularly helpful. We had booked a room at 175 euros a night without breakfast which seemed quite expensive for a place of this quality. As the hotel was very busy we were given an upgrade to a Club Room but weren't allowed to have free wi-fi because it was an upgrade. The room was fine - quite big with a sitting area. We went to the Sky Bar because we had been given a discount voucher for drinks. It was so dingy and dated - and empty because the price of drinks was astronomical. We had 2 local beers and 2 glasses of local white wine and were charged 66 lira ( Â£ 33 ).I could understand therse prices in a 5 star in the middle of a Western European city but not in a shabby room in an outlying area 0f Istanbul. We used the Club Lounge for breakfast and for evening drinkis as these were free. It was a much nicer room to sit in. The Cafe 333 downstairs was OK for dinner as there was nothing else nearby and it was too expensive to keep going round by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and nice big room”
Reviews.Author: thejarven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a bit outside the city center. We chose this hotel based on price and comfort. Our first hotel room was large and was high in the hotel, but smelled bad and was quite dirty window after conversations with the reception room was replaced with a new one the next day. We were a large corner room with two windows in two directions. The breakfast that would be included the hotel room was not included. We were again talk to the reception, which solved this. Hotel breakfast was not of the highest caliber. The missing most toppings, juice and bread. The range was limited and somewhat boring. Gym with a spa facility was great. Gymdelen itself was renovated and fresh. Spa Chamber with jacussin and the pool was dirty and generally ofrÃ¤sch. The walls of the sauna was moldy and the color of the walls had come loose. Jacussin was broken during our visit and when you look at the pictures the spa at the hotel's website does not correspond to how it looks - it looks not at all so fresh like the pictures! Really bad. Changing rooms were cold and lacked benches. Reception with business center was great. The staff was helpful and good command of English. We had problems with the checkout process on which the invoice was wrong but was corrected since. However, the hotel has made an extra spin on our show soon and we are still after about 4 weeks of check-out not had this corrected. Bad! Overall, the hotel is fine. Friendly staff and you get a lot of money. Proximity to luxury Istinie park is really good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room @ reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LWFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Sheraton for 1 night due to a business meeting in an office nearby, location was the reason for the selection of the hotel. It seemed to be in a middle of an the business district. Room â€“ luxurious for Euro100 a night, it was a nice room. It was a corner room so it was likely to be larger than the others. There was a distinct lack of written information for example, where the facilities are, etc, which I am getting the feeling is a Turkish thing, this being the 3rd hotel Iâ€™d stayed in Turkey. Hotel entrance and lobby was too big and dark â€“ staff spoke reasonable English but didnâ€™t appear to provide an outstanding service Restaurant was reasonable â€“ it was a Chinese/Korean restaurant with a reasonable amount of selection of meals. Service was swift and efficient, prices reasonable. Gym was big and busy in the evening but it was a bit grubby â€“ however it had a lot of equipment and there appeared to be a spinning class taking place â€“ but again there was no information on this. Wifi was available free of charge, but I had to phone reception to get the code otherwise it was pretty fast and stable. I also used the "business centre" which is an open area by reception with 4 computers and a printer, which I used to print my boarding pass for the following day. Breakfast â€“ I canâ€™t comment as I was there just for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: traveler1Morocco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but the location was no condusive to easy travel to the old medina. It was near a great mall, but since the hotel is located directly on a highway, it's really difficult to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super Business Hotel - Not for holidays”
Reviews.Author: GreekElvis
Reviews.Content: Great big rooms, tastefully decorated. Super big beds and even larger bathrooms. Fully stocked mini bar and extras. Professional and helpful staff. Only complain is the -very-slow check-out process: I have stayed here twice and both times it took more than 10 minutes to complete check-out!! Bar and lounge cosy and quite lively with excellent service. Its location is a problem if you are here for holidays and sightseeing. If you are here for business, this is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Only for business purposes”
Reviews.Author: TripleDutch
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Maslak is in itself a good hotel with a few flaws. The location however, is good for business purposes only. As many reviewers pointed out it, is far away from the old center. If you need to be in the Maslak financial district it is oke. Taking a taxi from the airport , it very much depends on traffic how much time it will take you to get to the hotel: it can be done in around 20 - 30 minutes but also may take you more than an hour. We were in a company car but they told me that a private taxi should be around 50 - 60 turkish lira (around EUR 25). Be prepared for an exciting ride because in Istanbul there are a lot of aggressive drivers on the road who squeeze their cars in every spot they see. The lobby is nice and check-in efficient. We had some drinks in the lobby bar which has a good atmosphere. I stayed in one of the club rooms which was big and comfortable and equipped with flatsscreen etc.There was one pitfall, the temperature was 26 degrees celsius in the room (outside only 16 degrees celsius so they must have turned up the heating). Since the airconditioning was not working, the only way to make it bearable was to open the window. I don't have any trouble sleeping, but if you are a light sleeper this might cause problems for you because of the busy road next to the hotel. Breakfast in the morning was not up to a 5 star level and imho not worth the price of around EUR 20. All in all, if you need to be in the Maslak financial district, this is probably the best option with a few flaws but if you are a tourist there definitely better options.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but I wouldnt stay again.”
Reviews.Author: travelmk86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok but not the best out there for sure. I stayed one night since my hotel was full for the last night. Looks wise it is a older building and they did renovate it includint the rooms,but cut corners everywhere they could. This is quite disappointing since you pay 200 euros and its not worth that price at all. I had the deluxe room which had alot of space but i could feel the cheapness of the room. In the bathroom they just painted a wall a dark color and changed the faucets for an "update." It was really hot in the room as well. I had to keep the air conditioning on since it would heat up so fast. I stayed here in the fall, i cant imagine how it would be in the summer time. The room service food was also disappointing. I had the chicken ceaser salad and kebap with potatoes. I tried a little bit but ended up just leaving it. Later i ordered the Club sandwhich and that was good. I also had breakfast in the morning which was not self serve and basic. I ordered scrambled eggs with cheese and they came cold. So im not sure if thats the way it was suppose to be or what...but they were really cold. The location is on the Asian side so if you are planning to do the old city sights and go often to the European side, there is a lot of traffic in Istanbul so it might take you more than an hour. But if there is no traffic you will be there is about 15 mins. It is located in the financial district. I would maybe stay here again if i had no other hotel to choose, but its definitly not my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, average hotel. Good for business travelers, bad for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Flightweary
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, well equipped for the business traveler and the bed was very comfortable. However, housekeeping neglected to supply fresh towels in the room when they took the soiled ones away. No option was given to reuse towels on the rail. I was there for four days and my day usually ended by calling up housekeeping for fresh towels. Annoying, to say the least. The towel situation also happened to my colleague who was staying in a different room on a different floor. The lobby had a Sheraton business lounge with free WIFI, but on the whole the lobby was much too dark. It looked like a sleazy night club all the time. Breakfast was included in the room price. The spread is ok if you like cold cuts, fruit and yoghurt, but the hot breakfast choices were less than spectacular. It would have been nice to have an omelette chef like other 5-star hotels. The only eggs available in the spread were hard boiled ones or runny scrambled eggs made from a mix. It's a decent business hotel catering to the Maslak business crowd, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who in Istanbul as a tourist. It's too far away from the sights and the hotel has no local flavour.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Shame about the location.”
Reviews.Author: ASO82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as was attending an event at the nearby Refresh The Venue (a 10 minute walk around the corner). I noted from a sign cleverly placed near the front desk that this is a privately owned hotel, not a 'true' Sheraton. Pros: Friendly staff. Standard room was very large, modern and very clean. Nice big 32" flat-screen on the wall if you like that kind of thing. Huge and comfortable king-size bed. Cons: Bathroom totally brought the room class down. I would have rated 5* otherwise. Old and in need of renovation. We were not informed when we parked our car that parking is not free. When checking out, this costs an additional 20TL. Location is not good for people who want to visit the centre of Istanbul. This is more a business hotel than anything else. I would recommend people that come to Istanbul for tourist reaons, to pick a hotel closer to the centres (Taksim, Sultanahmet).

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel....but the location!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tommy-moscow
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotels with my friends in October 2008 for 10 days (B&B fare) ..... it was really a very nice hotel ..very friendly cooperative staff with a delicious breakfast..... the room was big and renovated with WIFI access, also they have 6 computers in the lobby free of charge for the Internet public use. the only problem was the location : prepare yourself to pay Taxi 20 $$ every time you want to go to the old city ....or just wait a little and take the free shuttle (i think its only 4 times a day)..... the swimming pool was small and the sauna was a small cabinet but clean .. however the Turkish bath was some how smelly ..!!! i did not use it..... apart from its location ,i think its really VERY nice hotel with small swimming pool and Excellent services ... and definitely deserve to be in the top 25 hotels in Istanbul for its standards....

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a long way out of town”
Reviews.Author: sralls
Reviews.Content: Plus point - a large clean room, Neg points - about 1 hours by train into the centre of town (the train just opened the day before we arrived) and with the lobby lighting it looks like a cave.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, Poor English, No Coffee”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaLightbird
Reviews.Content: Oh, Istanbul. Sorry, but if it weren't for my SPG membership I would have stayed elsewhere. The highlights? Huge, spacious, clean room with an iron and board. The disappointments? Bad location, poor english, low water pressure and a strict no food/beverage policy. Ok, this location is out of the way of anything fun. Its in the new business district. A taxi to the Taksim Square costs about 20 USD one way. You can take the minibus to the subway (About 3 USD) but that is timely, confusing and cumbersome. For me, I would've gotten a hotel where the action, restaurants, shopping, cultural spots, transportation lines are conveniently located like in the Taksim Square area. The Sheraton Maslak has a free hotel shuttle that takes to you Taksim Square three times a day. The problem is that the driver doesn't go straight to Taksim Square. He drops his pals off along the way enroute to Taksim Square. It felt like a public bus. This was frustrating. One day, I came back to the hotel with Starbucks coffee in my hand and the security guard would not allow me to bring it in due to a strict hotel no food/beverage policy. He insisted I finish the coffee outside. "Please, finish your drink outside!" So, I spoke with the manager and he confirmed the no food/beverage policy. I never felt so insulted and humiliated. That's because beers cost 10 USD each in the bar. So, ask for prices before you order to avoid sticker shock. Also, they screwed up my reservations and I did not get the free breakfast for the first two days I was there. I tried to explain that our conference coordinators made a contract but to no avail. On the third day they fixed it, apologized profusely and I got the breakfast included in my rate. There was a noise of trickling and running water in my bathroom they couldn't resolve. I think the noise came from a water pipe in the walls. The building is relatively new so there are occassion popping sounds resulting from construction and building materials settling in that woke me up in the middle of the night. There is free wireless internet only in the lobby along with four internet ready desktop computers. Internet is not free in the rooms. Surprisingly, the staff doesn't speak english very well and I had to ask for the same thing several times but in different ways. Frustrating indeed. Regarding cultural sites: The Grand Bazaar inside and out. Although both will haggle and negotiate keep this in mind - Grand Bazaar shops inside? Expensive. Grand Bazaar shops outside? Better prices. Blue Mosque? Worth it. Despite sign posted at the entrance, women should cover their hair but westerners don't and Men shouldn't wear shorts but westerners do. A Bosphorous River Boat Ride? Yes, definitely. It'll cost about 30 USD for a two hour ride with a shopping/restaurant stop in the middle. Beware of carpet/rug salesmen who start out offering rugs at 3000 USD and drop it down to 500 USD..."This is only for you my good friend...And, It is my best price!". Overall, I'm sorry but I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels where I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: feranora
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sheraton Istanbul Maslak Hotel for 2 nights in March. I had a beautiful room on the 18th floor. All staff were very friendly and I am absolutely satiesfied with the service as well. I loved the italian restaurant. Link@sheraton is a great place if you need to use the internet. Also the hotel has a free shuttle bus to the city center. I recommend to anyone to stay at Sheraton Istabul Maslak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 18th floor facing a corporate tower. The room was recently renovated and was of decent size. Very clean, contemporary and well kept room. The building used to belong to a few other chains back in the day so it is not the best looking tower in town. Also the common areas such as the halways, lobby, elavators, etc. are still from the older days and do not look that nice. Check in and check out was extremely slow. The lobby is very ugly almost without any exposure to sun light. Very odd. Location is good if you need to be in the Maslak/Istinye/Levent Region. Unless you go to the great mall (Istinye Park) about 500ms across the highway, there is no where to eat or even drink outside the hotel. A typical business traveller hotel. If you need something more elegant and sophisticated, try the MÃ¶venpick down the road. Its also right beside the subway stop that can take you directly to the Taksim/Beyoglu area where you can walk to the historic sites or take the funicular down to Kabatas and hop on the street car for a panaromic ride that will take you through a historical ride to Sultan Ahmet or even to the airport. If you are looking for a romantic gateway and need to be near the touristic sites, the Sheraton Maslak is not for you. For the business travel needing to be near the financial district, this a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but two critical flaws”
Reviews.Author: canucks64
Reviews.Content: Just returned 27 March 09 from a week long business trip. We stayed at the Sheraton Maslak based on a recommendation from a colleague in Instanbul, as it was the closest reputable hotel based on our needs. Though I've stayed in better hotels, I've also stayed in MUCH worse hotels. I'm admittedly not a Sheraton devotee, but I'm also not dead against the chain -- they're just another "higher end" chain. As a Sheraton hotel, I believe this was more or less standard fare for the Sheraton name. Here's my scoop from 4 or 5 key prespectives: Staff: professional and courteous. Always available and willing to assist. Room: decent, suitable furnishings....BUT -- the lack of individual climate control ability in your room is reminiscent of hotels from a generation earlier. While there is in fact a thermostat control in the room, it's of absolutely no use. Like other reviewers, I ended up contacting the front desk about the sauna-like temperature of my room (26C), only to be told the same as a couple of other reviewers -- the hotel has a central heating/cooling system, so it can only be adjusted centrally. My solution: open the window and tolerate the occasional gale force wind. Bed: exceedingly comfortable. In-house food/drink: obscenely overpriced, especially the 45.00 YTL breakfast charge. Cost: At 180.00 Euro per night, it should include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a larger room with Starwood Gold Card. Staff were very helpful. Beds comfy with plasma TV. Hotel felt very new. Would stop again.

Reviews.Title: “My second home”
Reviews.Author: NRWSA
Reviews.Content: I am currently stayÄ±ng at the Sheraton Hotel Ä±n Maslak because my husband Ä±s workÄ±ng Ä±n Istanbul for 6 months..The hotel Ä±s Ä±n a busÄ±ness dÄ±strÄ±ct whÄ±ch suÄ±ts us perfectly Ä±n terms of locatÄ±on, yes, Ä±t Ä±s a dÄ±stance from the tourÄ±sty areas but we've managed to navÄ±gate our way around by usÄ±ng a combÄ±natÄ±on of the free hotel shuttle, metro, taxÄ± and the popular Ä±nexpensÄ±ve mÄ±nÄ±buses also known as dolmus. The hotel Ä±s perfect Ä±f you are conductÄ±ng busÄ±ness Ä±n the area or nearby, otherwÄ±se I would not recommend Ä±t only because traffÄ±c Ä±s a nÄ±ghtmare Ä±n Istanbul and you could Ä±nevÄ±tably be delayed should you have meetÄ±ngs etc at peak tÄ±mes!! As a tourÄ±st I thÄ±nk you would probably want to stay closer to the maÄ±n attractÄ±ons of the cÄ±ty so the Sheraton mÄ±ght not be a suÄ±table optÄ±on but that Ä±s just my opÄ±nÄ±on because the hotel seems to be frequented by tourÄ±sts as well. We have not encountered any problems Ä±n terms of servÄ±ce, we have a suÄ±te on one of the hÄ±gher floors wÄ±th stunnÄ±ng vÄ±ews and breakfast Ä±s Ä±ncluded whÄ±ch Ä±s a plus, as wÄ±th all hotels dÄ±nÄ±ng Ä±n Ä±s always expensÄ±ve and so Ä±s room servÄ±ce, drÄ±nks Ä±n the lounge etc..By the way there Ä±s complÄ±mentary Ä±nternet access Ä±n the lobby whÄ±ch Ä±s extremely useful Ä±f lÄ±ke me you want to keep Ä±n touch wÄ±th famÄ±ly and frÄ±ends. Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service! Very friendly. Needs maintainence.”
Reviews.Author: indianajonesfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Istanbul, Turkey, and the Maslak Sheraton made our stay more than memorable! The staff is very friendly and goes out of their way to make you feel like V.I.P.! Breakfast buffet is very nice and the complimentary water bottles in the room are a great plus. Only downside...the air conditioning did not work in either room. Luckily we were staying in the cool time of the year, although the rooms got too warm at night. Both rooms were finely decorated and very roomy. We will definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff in old hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoyle75
Reviews.Content: The fitness area was great.The room was old and worn smelled of cigarette smoke.But the staff were great and helpful. Nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Good 2nd impression”
Reviews.Author: pemaki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. The check-in staff was really friendly, though the room was really disappointing. The carpet was worn, the room smelled of cigarettes. Next morning i've asked for a non-smoking room (as initially booked) which was honoured right away and i got a new room - which looked way better than 901. It seemed to be recently renovated and even had a proper tv set. The breakfast was ok, but not worth the money. One word of advice - i made the mistake of booking this hotel on the European side but i had to travel every morning to the Asian side - not a good idea unless you fancy spending 1.5 hours in a cab to manage the 15 kilometers...

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about a week while in Turkey on business. The location is quite far away from any type of attraction or decent restaurant. There is a free shuttle that goes to Taksim Square four times a day but the last day return is an early 10pm. A taxi ride to the tourist area was well over 30 dollars. You can take the city bus from the front of the hotel to Taksim, it takes well over an hour but only costs 1.50 ytl â€“ not for the faint of travel. As for the hotel, the renovated rooms are very nice, spacious and well appointed. The bathrooms are a little out of place in the nice contemporary room though. The water ran brown on more than one occasion. Calls to reception had it solved within twenty or thirty minutes. The biggest surprise to me about this hotel was the prices. A Corona in the lobby really does cost around $20 us dollars. The room service food is equally overpriced and of average quality. They hype their L`Altra Risacca restaurant, but the consensus among my group was it was severely overpriced and of questionable quality. I could not stand to go back after two nights. Something that is not published on their website or in-room guide books is the Asian restaurant (called Mi Do I think) hidden at the way back of the lobby. It had great authentic food, while still tourist prices it is no where near as bad as the rest of the properties price-gouging offerings. Also, the much promoted Sky-Bar was â€œclosed for the summerâ€� when I arrived in June. All in all, I would never stay here again. It does not have a great location and the hotel does not really live up to the Sheraton Brand. It is severely over-priced and the staff for the most part are clearly new to the hospitality industry.
